review_title: Dr. Powell was a good president
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros: I disagree with the views stated by some of the disgruntled employees. Dr. Powell was the first president in a very long time who took control and did the job of a president. He built community, he put the students and faculty first. He was fair to staff and encouraged growth and excellence. When he first came on board, not knowing the history, he was very closed and strict. But once he got to know us, and saw what our purpose in the community is he was fully on board. The problem for some is that he wants accountability and some could not deal with having to be accountable. He did a great job. He had integrity and purpose. He loved this university. It was not his fault JFKU became part of the National University System. The previous president did that. We are not owned by National University. I wish people would stop telling that lie. We are affiliated with the National University System. We may or may not agree with all of the decisions but we either roll with it or find a new job. Telling half-truths does not serve anyone. As far as the review about Dr. Powell eaves dropping on confidential conversations; I do not believe it. I have worked with him in a leadership capacity, as a staff member, and have attended meetings with him. He has never shown any dishonesty or manipulation. Maybe there was a justified reason this person was being scrutinized.
cons: The career ladder should be extended to work within the affiliates.

review_title: JFK University is an excellent place to be!
job_title: Professor in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros:
The faculty are outstanding.  One-on-one attention and support from admission through graduation that is individualized and personal.  The building, parking, and location are assets.  The "family like" culture is felt the minute one walks through the front door.  50 years of history educating future lawyers and other legal professionals, therapists, counselors, business leaders, among other exciting professions.  Service is at the heart of this institution.  
Work life balance for faculty is outstanding.
Benefits are really good, especially the matching 401K option.
The amount of "shared governance" with faculty senior leadership supports here is outstanding.
cons:
With 50 years of history comes 50 years of memories and opinions that are hard to change.  Staff and faculty can tend to get stuck on what we can't do than what we can do if we think a little differently than we have in the past.  
We tend to make some bad hiring decisions in key areas presumably due to cost savings, and then do little to change those decisions, instead putting work that should be done elsewhere on the few (many?) that are truly competent.  .

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros: JFK boasts a long history of socially responsible education inspired by JFK himself.  Being part of that legacy is tremendously exciting.
cons: JFKU is now affiliated with National University.  Since that relationship began, NU has slowly and steadily robbed JFKU of all the innovation and integrity that was core to the organizational values and replaced it with program goals destined for failure.  It is clear that NU is only interested in a few of JFKU's programs, specifically their law school, desiring to make JFK into the JFK Law School at National University. Most other programs are deemed competitive to NU's existing curricula and are slowly strangled to death by budget cuts and high enrollment demands coupled with marketing restrictions.  The JFKU board is a figurehead with all decisions forced down from the NU board.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros: I love my supervisor. Administration is approachable. Excellent Benefits - especially medical.  Warm staff and faculty. Excellent programs, tuition waver option which is  excellent for those like me working to get or complete a degree!
cons: Salaries are on low side, but administration is working on correcting that. Some slacker employees that seem to stick around longer than they should with bad attitudes.   Not enough staff to support departments,  and faculty and staff have too much on their plate to be able to really excel in their position. People burn out and leave because of it and work after hours due to the pressure to get everything done.

job_title: Student Services Specialist in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros: The Focus and intent of students in their academic programs are inspiring. The Faculty and staff hold a high commitment to students' success. A small core of long term employees extend support and camaraderie to newer staff.
cons: Many and varied changes that seem to occur constantly make for an unsettled and chaotic environment and negatively affect morale. Internal Communication is haphazard and leads to confusion about who is responsible for what.

review_title: Wonderful students, enjoyable place to work
job_title: Student Advisor in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros:
-The students that attend JFK University make this a wonderful place to come to work each day.  I am blessed to be in a position that helps students have a better experience, and because of this, they enhance my work experience and my life.  JFK University provides me with the support and the opportunities I need to thrive in my career and serve the students well.  
-When I started here I had "a job", but due to encouraging supervisors and co-workers, both past and present, I quickly acquired a fulfilling career in education.  
-I feel my knowledge and job responsibilities are respected by leadership and my experience with the supervision level has been positive.  
-I am fortunate to be part of a workplace where respected education professionals and caring co-workers choose  to work.  In this place of higher learning I have access to new and valuable information every day, and for that I am grateful.  
-In 2008 we became affiliated with a university system which allows us access to resources we lacked as a sole entity.  The medical, retirement and vacation benefits are generous and my salary has kept up with the industry.  
-In the last few years, the University has made significant strides in shifting to a more positive culture.  I am encouraged that this trend will continue in the same direction.
cons:
-Some members of the University complain and whine.  This is annoying.  However, instead of creating an environment that promotes whining and complaining, this institution needs to provide a healthy way for the hourly employees to affect change.  There are times when co-workers reveal that they want certain changes at the institution.  Realistically, not everyone's requests can happen, but at least if the hourly workers have a way to voice their concerns about changes, and these concerns are genuinely listened to and considered, this could cut down on whining and complaining.
-When negative actions toward the hourly worker population occurs, there is no forum for discussion or non-threatening system that allows the workers to provide input to leadership that could affect a different change that might result in less damage to morale.  
-The supervisory level needs training in proper communication methods with their workers.  They also need to be encouraged and learn how to recognize and promote the valuable team players in their office. 
-The energy of the university's culture has made a positive shift, and continues in this direction, but there is still work needed to allow more of its employees to achieve the success that comes from inside promotions and employee recognition.

job_title: Outreach Advisor in Berkeley, CA
pros: John F. Kennedy University has excellent faculty who are devoted to making certain that their students are prepared to work by giving them real life examples. The faculty are not only teachers, but they work in their fields. Pros - interesting people to work with. An employee allowance allows to attend classes for free. The Holistic programs are unique bringing in diverse faculty and students and unusual events. The administration is always proactively developing new methods to run the university.
cons: The university is becoming more corporate with its partnership with National University.

job_title: Advisor in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros: The entire atmosphere, including students, faculty and staff; across all the programs, produces a community focused environment.  This creates an immediate impact on a feeling of "making a difference" right now.
cons: The Pleasant Hill main facility and campus is very friendly but generally the classes tend to be small, and though that allows for person attention from the teacher you don't get more extensive interaction with other students.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Pleasant Hill, CA
pros: Community focused, great Co workers, great retirement.
cons:
Marketing, innovation are needing to step their game up. Decision making takes weeks, that is not how to run a business. You lose momentum during those weeks of delay. 
Your focus is on student enrollment. Take a look at other large universities and mimic their look and feel. Reputation is great, but marketing and economic system for students are lacking.

review_title: The University used to be very caring but the current president is one of the meanest most arrogant people in the planet

pros: The faculty is generally above average; mostly experienced adjuncts. Some programs like Entrepreneurship and Psychology are good.  The Administration is totally uncaring.
cons: The President is all about himself. He has no morals nor cares.  He continually demeans everyone.  Dissatisfaction is very high, and of course enrollment is down.  Many staff members are afraid of management. This should not be an accredited institution.  The Board must be blind or uncaring.
